title: Under the sustainable sea(weeds): gimme Seaweed talks eco-friendly and organic snacks - FoodNavigator-USA.com
summary: The article discusses Gimme Seaweed's sustainable, organic, and non-GMO seaweed production, highlighting its environmentally friendly packaging, distribution strategies, bold flavors, and nutrient content.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses sustainable and organic seaweed production methods, highlighting the company's efforts to minimize environmental impacts.
business_innovation: TRUE - The article showcases Gimme Seaweed's introduction of innovative products and packaging formats to enhance consumer convenience and sustainability.
green_product: TRUE - The article discusses Gimme Seaweed's seaweed snacks which are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE - The article highlights Gimme Seaweed's sustainable production processes that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311999 - All Other Miscellaneous Food Manufacturing, 311410 - Frozen Food Manufacturing, 325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing, 424450 - Confectionery Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE - The article provides detailed information about Gimme Seaweed's sustainable and environmentally friendly practices, without any indication of greenwashing.

title: Wheat replacement: South Korea partners with local food brands to intensify rice flour NPD - FoodNavigator-Asia.com
summary: The Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs in South Korea is collaborating with 15 major local food and beverage firms to develop 19 new rice-based products this year, aiming to address supply-demand balance issues and promote food sovereignty by utilizing powdered rice as a new food ingredient.
green_innovation: TRUE. This collaboration between the Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs and local food and beverage firms to develop new rice-based products aligns with the goal of reducing negative environmental externalities by utilizing rice flour as a substitute for wheat flour, thus contributing to sustainability in the food industry.
business_innovation: TRUE. The introduction of new rice-based products in collaboration with the Ministry of Agriculture and food and beverage firms is a significant departure from previous products in the South Korean market, making it a business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. The development of new rice-based products that aim to reduce environmental impact through sustainable production processes and the use of environmentally benign materials qualifies them as green products.
green_process: TRUE. By focusing on utilizing powdered rice as a new food ingredient to address supply-demand balance issues and promote food sovereignty, the development of rice-based products aligns with the definition of green processes that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
official_company_name: Nongshim Co., Ltd., Samyang Foods Co., Ltd., Pulmuone Co., Ltd.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311920 - Coffee and Tea Manufacturing, 311822 - Flour Mixes and Dough Manufacturing from Purchased Flour, 311813 - Frozen Cakes, Pies, and Other Pastries Manufacturing, 311821 - Cookie and Cracker Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE. The article text describes a genuine effort by the Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs in South Korea and collaborating companies to develop rice-based products using powdered rice as a sustainable ingredient. There are no indications of false or misleading claims regarding the environmental benefits of the products.
